text.__SUMMARY__:
Grevillea oldei is a shrub which is endemic to  New South Wales in Australia.It  grows to between 0.4 and 1.2 metres high.  The leaves are 1 to 3.5 cm long, and 1.5 to 6 mm wide and often have sharply pointed tips. Flowers appear between  June and February (early winter to late summer) in its native range. These have red perianths and styles.Grevillea oldei occurs in eucalypt woodland or heath between Mangrove Mountain and Woy Woy.The species was first formally described in 1986 by Donald McGillivray. The name honours Peter Olde. Before the species being described, plants of this species were identified as either Grevillea trinervis or Grevillea capitellata.
